snippet: The winner of the 2000 Pulitzer Prize brings his new work, “Vespers Cantata: Hesperus Is Phosphorus,” to New York, with its sections culling from the work of varied authors.
abstract: Zachary Woolfe reviews New York premiere of composer Lewis Spratlan's cantata Vespers Cantata: Hesperus Is Phosphorus, performed by the chamber choir the Crossing, at Park Avenue Christian Church.
lead_paragraph: The winner of the 2000 Pulitzer Prize brings his new work, “Vespers Cantata: Hesperus Is Phosphorus,” to New York, with its sections culling from the work of varied authors.

headline.seo: ‘Hesperus Is Phosphorus,’ Lewis Spratlan’s New Work
headline.main: The Choir, the Clarinet and the Adrienne Rich Part
headline.print_headline: The Choir, the Clarinet and the Adrienne Rich Part
